boardgame.name: Vast Kaviya
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blood, grit, and survival are at the fore in these primordial lands.

If you like Conan the Barbarian, Xena the Warrior Princess, Tarzan, Fafrhd, Khal Drogo, Thundarr, Red Sonja, Grognar, the Scorpion King, Beowulf, Kull the Conqueror, Fire and Ice, or are just a fan of savage adventures on a primal and untamed world—Vast Kaviya is for you!

This super massive world of primal struggle is a decentralized campaign setting and bestiary (22 areas with 100+ statblocks) for D&D 5th Edition. Within are 21 different warlords all with their own lairs, minions, and guidelines for how they interact with one another, giving GMs a new toolbox of NPCs and unique areas to either include in their homebrew fantasy setting for some old school sword and sorcery, or to gradually discover using the book's Exploration Rules! There are 13 major tenets about the world that are true no matter where one travels however.

In addition to what's in the core 5th Edition rules Vast Kaviya has a variety of new character options for the brave souls that strike out across its countless lands.

New Races! Joining classics like boggards, gnolls, and mongrelfolk are the plant-like alai, insectile kanca, parasitic ottunni, and saurian taino-kar. There's also new subraces for aasimar (elated, soul, and vindico) as well as genasi (acid, ash, mist, and mud), dwarves (mistdweorg), and halflings (mistling).
New Class Archetypes! Path of the Psion-Primal barbarians, Lunar clerics, Burning druids, Primal Leader fighters, Pyrokine monks, Oath of Web paladins, Primal Hunter rangers, Savage Poisoner rogues, Animator sorcerers, Dreamer sorcerers, and two new warlock patrons (the Grandmother and Hivemind).
New Classes! The dual-natured agile warrior gemini class appears here with the atavist, equalist, and reluctant hero balances, and it's got a new archetype that revolves around day and night—the nychthemeron. If you've always wanted to tame a simple-minded creature to go on adventures with (be that an aberration, beast, dragon, monstrosity, or ooze of Intelligence 5 or less), look no further than the monster tamer class! There are also four unique 8 level prestige classes: elementalists that ultimately transform into their chosen element, fractured soul shapeshifters with nuanced control over their bodies, magic-eaters that become tougher and more lethal by rejecting all things supernatural, and primal shamans that unlock primitive psionic powers.
New Options! Discover who your Amnesiac background adventurer truly is, gain control over slivers of magic using naturally occurring raw mana, or take a feat to embrace your mistdweorg ancestors or the illumination granted by the underground City of Lost's potent Sun Stone—or set your sights on stealing the legendary gemstone!


There's a bestiary chapter with more than thirty different monsters—ranging from the little forvirskrípi to the enormous megawolf—and a host of devastating versions of creatures players will think they already know how to handle, but the real focus of Vast Kaviya is the warlords fighting to carve out more of the world for themselves.

boardgame.name: L' Apéro Jeu Vendéen
boardgame.description:
L'Apéro Jeu vendéen
For an aperitif with family or friends, share a funny and friendly moment while having fun with the expressions in patois (local slang)!

8 types of games for adults and children.

boardgame.name: Vast Kaviya: Warlord Encounters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF expands the cultures, regions, and warlords in the brutal and barbaric Vast Kaviya campaign setting with 21 pages full of detailed encounters perfect for use in any savage campaign using the DnD 5E rules!

boardgame.name: Vast Kaviya: Naked Dragon's Lair
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

GMs using their own homebrew worlds will be in good shape as well but the adventure is best when played in the gritty, hard fought, and desperate sword-and-sandal lands of Vast Kaviya.

Rumors spread of a mysterious group at the top of Mukkiya Mountain paying high bounties for live halflings—not just gold coins but even items imbued with magic. Raiders far and wide have started abducting whole settlements of smallfolk yet the village of Stillwater is trying to stand up to these foul kidnappers, seeking out hardened protectors to defend them. Whatever side the adventurers take brings them to the mountain but ascending it is no simple matter and the party must bypass the baring horde, climb the Cliffs of Madness, cross the territory of a dreaded ayutam, or maneuver up the Spiked Slopes. When they reach their destination the PCs discover the truth behind the halfling bounty and face perhaps the mightiest creature they’ve ever seen!

A full adventure for 4–5 PCs of 6th level filled with gritty adventures in an unforgiving world.
Abduction raider (CR 8), baring (CR 2), ayutam (CR 9), and Bezkusmet the Unscaled (CR 10).
109 pieces of Raw Mana, a new kind of magic item specific to Vast Kaviya that introduces true rarity and granularity to spell access in D&D 5E.

boardgame.name: L' Apéro Jeu Berrichon
boardgame.description:
L'apéro jeu Berrichon
Both a quiz game and a guide, this object is a must have for discovering Berry while having fun.

In 210 questions, you will learn all the secrets of Berry's heritage, history, traditions, daily life and personalities.

boardgame.name: Treasure Tumble
boardgame.description:
You are an archaeologist who has finally uncovered a long rumored ancient treasure chamber. Glorious riches await you, but not without their challenges. Your excavations have unearthed ancient mechanisms that redirect treasure falling from great heights, how much can you now collect in your treasure buckets?

SETUP
Take your sushi roll case and lay it out on a flat surface. This will be the floor of your treasure chamber. Long press 2 Blinks until they flash white, then set them standing up on the sushi roll case. These are your treasure buckets. Take another Blink and set it between the two buckets. This trio of Blinks is the foundation of your treasure chamber.

Finally, take at least 1 Blink and triple click it. It should now be green with a swirling face. This Blink is your treasure spawner. It will drop one treasure piece whenever it is placed on top of the treasure chamber tower.

GAMEPLAY
The goal of this game is to collect as much treasure in your bucket as possible by using the mechanisms built into the treasure chamber walls.

The game is played in two stages. First, both players work together to assemble the treasure chamber. Take turns adding one Blink at a time to the tower and watching the mechanisms self-assign.

WIN CONDITION
When the bucket is full it will turn purple - the first player to fill their bucket with treasure is the winner!

However, if one of the players causes the tower to collapse, they must empty all the treasure from their bucket. Double-click a bucket to empty it. Then the first stage of the game is repeated and the tower is reassembled before treasure is allowed to tumble again.

boardgame.name: Dictator-y Little Bitch
boardgame.description:
2-6 players, 30-60 minutes, fully co-op, and inspired by video game boss battles and co-op games like Pandemic. The longer you play, the harder the game becomes, until there's nothing left for you to do except watch as the world burns.

Each player has an open hand of cards which are played to categories around the central Octagon in the hopes of reducing the villain's HP to zero before HE reduces the World's HP to zero. But cards only score when played atop other cards, and every time a turn is taken, the villain (the game itself) has a chance to remove players' cards from the Octagon before points can be scored against him. Not only that, but interspersed throughout the villain's deck are cards that render categories unusable for the rest of the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: UNO: BTS
우노: BTS
boardgame.description:
Basically the same as UNO, except with cards that feature the K-pop band BTS.

Cards that are different from traditional UNO:

The Dancing Wild card -- the next player in current order must perform a BTS dance routine in from of everyone OR draw three cards.

boardgame.name: Oléron, Aix, Madame Cube
boardgame.description:
270 Questions and answers on the islands of Oléron, Aix and Madame.
Can be played alone or with others, as a team or with friends!

Rules: Throw the 2 dice, you get 1 color and 1 number, your opponent chooses a card corresponding to the color and asks you question 1, 2 or 3.

Scoring: 1 point for a correct yellow or orange answer, 2 for a green or a blue and 3 points for a purple or a red.

Content: 90 cards of 3 questions (answers on the back),
6 card colors representing the degree of difficulty,
1 die of 6 colors and 1 die with the numbers 1,2 and 3

boardgame.name: Ré Cube
boardgame.description:
Discover the island of Ré in a fun way, while learning about history, geography, various facts ...
Can be played alone or with others, as a team or with friends!

Rules: Roll the 2 dice, you get 1 color and 1 number.
Your opponent chooses a card corresponding to the suit and asks you question n ° 1, 2 or 3.
Scoring: 1 point for a correct yellow or orange answer, 2 for a green or blue and 3 points for a purple or red.

Content: 90 cards of 3 questions (answers on the back), 6 color cards representing the degree of difficulty, 1 die of 6 colors and 1 die with the numbers 1, 2 and 3.

boardgame.name: La Rochelle Cube
boardgame.description:
La Rochelle Cube 288 questions and answers about La Rochelle'

Discover La Rochelle in a playful and entertaining way, learn about history, geography, various facts ...

Can be played alone, with others, as a team or with friends.

Rules: Roll 2 dice, you get 1 color and a number. Your opponent chooses a card corresponding to the suit and asks you question 1, 2 or 3.

Scoring: 1 point for a correct yellow or orange answer, 2 for a green or blue and 3 for a purple or red.

Content': 96 cards of 3 questions (answers on the back), 6 color cards representing the degree of difficulty, 1 die of 6 colors, and 1 die with the numbers 1,2 and 3.

boardgame.name: Paris Cube
boardgame.description:
Paris Cube 288 questions and answers to discover PARIS.

Can be played alone or with others but the most fun is in a team!

Rules: Roll 2 dice, you get 1 number and 1 color. Your opponent chooses a card of the color drawn and asks you question n ° 1, 2 or 3 corresponding to the number of the other die.
Scoring: 1 point for the 1st question, 2 for the 2nd and 3 points for the 3rd.

Content:
96 card classified by colored themes: characters, monuments, squares and streets, arts, entertainment, the Seine, metro, neighborhoods, markets, cemeteries ...
A 6 colors die and a die numbered 1,2,3.

boardgame.name: Mountains of the Realms
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Mountains of the Realms explores the imposing monuments of the distant horizon. In our travels, we've found new and old flora, fauna, and history to bring to you about the fens and mires of the Realms. Mountains of the Realms does this through both narrative prose, written from the perspective of Amarune Whitewave (the great, great granddaughter of Elminster Aumar), and through occasional notes from her husband, editor, and traveling companion Arclath Delcastle.

boardgame.name: Brush Brothers Paint Co.
boardgame.description:
Brush Brothers Paint Co. is a family friendly color mixing card game. Brush Brothers plays in 15 min, is for 2-6 players and is for ages 8 and up.

In Brush Brothers, players are new employees for the Brush Brothers Paint Co. and are seeking to make a good first impression by mixing colors and completing company goals.

In this color based deck building game, players compete to collect paint cards and meet goals before the day’s end.

On a player turn, players may perform a variety of actions including mixing paint, matching paint, and meeting company goals.

To mix paint, players may mix any of the colors in their hand to pick up paint colors from the center row. For instance, I could use red and yellow to create orange.

To match colors players may pick up a color if they already have that exact color in their hand.

To meet company goals, players declare that they are seeking to meet a goal and if they have the required colors in their play area, they may collect the goal card.

Any cards used for an action are then placed in the player discard and can cycle through their deck back into their hand on a later turn.

Players start with an even mix of red, yellow, blue and white and can collect a variety of other colors. In this way every card can help to build your deck. Excluding the starter cards, every card is worth points at the end of the game.

The game ends when the center pile runs out. The player with the most points wins.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Terror in the Ice
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An unfortunate voyage adventure for 4-6 characters of 5th-10th level.
The adventure also includes suggestions for incorporating it into the official artic-set adventures such as Storm King’s Thunder and Rime of the Frostmaiden, as well as into your own campaigns.

The Faraway Explorers are a company of treasure hunters currently operating out of the city of Luskan. They have recently discovered the ruins of an ancient fortress of the giants called Knorlfesting, located on an uncharted island in the Sea of Moving Ice. During a successful expedition to explore the ruins, so many artifacts of historical significance and value were discovered that they could not fit on the expedition ship to bring back.

Upon returning to Luskan, a second expedition was quickly mounted to pick up the remaining artifacts. In addition to the Erebos—the company’s own ship—a former pirate ship called the Terror of Ten Towns was leased and retrofitted for the icebound journey.

Along with a sailing crew and the members of the exploration company, a number of adventurers were hired on to assist the expedition.

An uneventful outbound journey allowed for the safe loading of the remaining artifacts into the ships’ cargo holds and the two ships set out on the return journey across the Sea of Moving Ice.

boardgame.name: Rise of the Bear King
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An Icewind Dale adventure for 4-6 characters of 4th-6th level.

This adventure occurs in 1491 DR. Rime of the Frostmaiden lists 1489 DR or later, and the timeline of the events in this adventure can be altered as well. What's important is this adventure works perfectly in Rime of the Frostmaiden and we highly recommend it!

Six years ago, in 1485 DR, Icewind Dale’s Tribe of the Bear was led by two chieftains: Wolvig Barrundson and Günvald Halraggson. The Ice Witch rose to power in Icewind Dale and Wolvig followed her, leading his people into evil. The Ice Witch fell, as all tyrants do, and Wolvig fell with her. As the last remaining chieftain, Günvald Halraggson was declared the Bear King and has spent the last six years rebuilding his people. To this day, the Tribe of the Bear is treated with wary suspicion from both the people of Ten-Towns and the other barbarian tribes, outcasts even in a land of outcasts.

A tenday ago, the Tribe of the Bear was given a sign: while hunting, they came across a mighty bear. Larger than any mortal bear, the tribe’s shaman Sindri declared this bear to be a Totem Bear, a sign from the spirits of the renewed strength and fortune of the Tribe of the Bear.

The tribe celebrated until nightfall came. At dusk, a corrupted bear rose from the ice. The Tribe of the Bear was no stranger to such creatures, undead monsters corrupted by the necromantic residue left over from the long-destroyed Crenshinibon. This monster, however, displayed remarkable intellect and savagery as it made a direct attack on the tribe’s Totem Bear.

The tribe managed to slay the corrupted bear, at some cost. But the next night, it rose again and resumed its assault on the Totem Bear. Each night since, the corrupted bear has risen to attack the Totem Bear, no matter where the tribe moves or how they kill it. Each night, more warriors fall to the beast, and the people grow tired from the constant moving and fighting with no time to rest or properly hunt. The tribe’s shaman Sindri fell during one such assault.

Secretly, the corrupted bear is more than a simple undead. The spirit of Wolvig Barrundson, made restless with rage, is assaulting the Totem Bear to destroy those who consider him a shameful part of their history. As long as Wolvig’s rage holds power, the corrupted bear can never be slain on the material plane.

Halvard, son of the shaman Sindri, suspects that there may be spirits involved. The barbarians of Icewind Dale distrust and fear magic, but Halvard has been trained by his father to know and respect the spirits. He does not know the spirit is Wolvig; he only suspects that some malevolent spirit is at work. He has proposed a journey into the spirit realm to face this evil spirit.

Unfortunately, Günvald has refused Halvard. To enter the spirit realm is the ability of a shaman, and Halvard never formally claimed the mantle. He would need to conduct a difficult ritual to become a shaman, but the tribe cannot spare the help until the nightly threat to the Tribe has passed. Günvald has ordered Halvard to fight as a barbarian, not to waste his efforts on magic. Günvald orders this without malice in his heart; he respects spirits and shamen, but is quickly losing able-bodied men to battle the corrupted bear.

Despite this, Halvard reached out to the spirits for guidance and followed them to Bryn Shander, capital and largest city of Ten-Towns. He seeks capable fighters to aid him — not with the corrupted bear, but to claim a victory in battle over one of the Dale’s mighty beasts that he might gather the components to become a shaman and enter the spirit realm.

boardgame.name: Divine Contention
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

The ruined town of Leilon was once a fortified settlement on the High Road midway between the cities of Neverwinter and Waterdeep. The Lord Protector of Neverwinter, Dagult Neverember, hired a group of his citizens to rebuild the town, a construction project that has recently completed. They hope to create a fortified waypoint for travelers and merchants that can ward off the threats of the surrounding wilderness.

Two forces of evil are on the rise nearby, eager to control the region around Leilon and eventually the Sword Coast for themselves. The first is a cult of Talos, god of storms, led by their champion Fheralai Stormsworm. The cult's headquarters are inside a death knight dreadnaught, an undead galleon, which prowls the coast looking for trade ships to plunder.

Ularan Mortus, a priest of Myrkul, god of death, and his followers are raising an army of undead to lay siege to the city of Neverwinter. The spirit of the dead black dragon Chardansearavitriol, known also as Ebondeath, has recently allied with Ularan Mortus to steal a mythical artifact called the ruinstone from a tower inside Leilon.

The people of Leilon have just begun to uncover the threats both groups pose to the region. They need the help of adventurers if they want their rebuilt settlement to survive the danger.

Divine Contention is a Dungeons & Dragons adventure designed for characters of 11th through 12th level set in the Sword Coast region of the Forgotten Realms campaign setting

boardgame.name: Hanamikoji: Geisha's Road
boardgame.description:
“Yoko… What lies ahead for us?” asked her friend Tomoyo.
Yoko stared out into the sea, calm and serene. “Today we are just maiko. But one day, we will complete our training and become known as geisha.”
“Yes, artists of the highest order. But then what?”
“Okaasan said that one day, perhaps some of us may be lucky to inherit the teahouse... if fortune favors us and our hard work.”

Welcome back to Hanamikoji! In Hanamikoji: Geisha's Road, a 30-minute two-player, competitive strategy game full of implicit intentions, veiled messages, and hidden actions, players represent rival but friendly patrons supporting Yoko, Tomoyo, and others along their journey from apprentice (maiko) to full geisha (artist) and perhaps even the owner (okaasan) of their own establishment.

To do so, players help their favored geisha advance and build prestige through performing their art at different teahouses. Geisha start as apprentices (maiko) but become full geisha and score prestige points after accruing the necessary patronage to return to their original teahouse (ochaya) for the graduation ceremony (erikae). Some geisha may continue their path further and eventually inherit the teahouse (upon a second return) to become the new okaasan, recognized with more prestige points.

At the end of the game, the player who provides the most support to each geisha is recognized. The player who has supported the most prestigious group of geisha wins the game.

User Summary

Side view roleplaying adventure game where you conquer the dungeon with heroes armed with magic and special attacks.

boardgame.description:
User Summary

Arcade style flight simulator where you take the helm of a commercial airplane.

boardgame.name: DEFCON 1
boardgame.description:
DEFCON 1 takes place during the cold war from 1950 to 1990. All cards and technologies are historically based.

Featuring different gameplay for each number of players:
2 players - Frontal Shock Game, nervous and tense.
3 players - Death Circle Game with secret objectives.
4 players - Semi Cooperation Game and Secret Objectives Game.
5 players - Secret Objective Game.

Each of the 5 aymmetrical blocs has its own strengths and weaknesses, through its own Technological tree, Mission and Objective cards, and even scalable pool of Units. Each player has Mission cards in their hands, and will gain rewards upon fulfilling each of them, bringing them closer to victory. As the DEFCON level decreases, depending on the actions of the players, new strategical options will become available like building nuclear bombs. There is also a Space Race which allows you to earn Influence and to add new Spatial Technologies on your Technological tree.

The game is played in 5 phases:
[0] Initialization: Refill your hand and collect resources (Oil, Uranium, Influence, R&D) depending on the zones under your control.
[1] R&D: With Research you may unlock Technologies. You may also invest in the Spatial Race.
[2] Political: With Influence, you have a possibility to Destabilise zones or take the Political control of the Destabilised zones.
[3] Production: Then, you may Produce available Units in zones you control that contain a Factory. You may also upgrade units.
[4] Atomic: If the DEFCON level has reached level 1, you may launch nuclear bombs (i.e. if you own the Technology).
[5] Warfare: Finally you may Redeploy units, Launch Attacks on Sea, Bombard, then Redeploy units, Launch Attacks on Land.

boardgame.name: Bier poker game

The most insane, immersive and drunken version of the world famous game that has captivated millions of people around the world.

Laughing DIY assignments, a delicious pot of beer, combined with the world-famous game of poker guarantee an incredibly pleasant evening.

Play a blood-curdling, strategic and downright drunken game for the big bucks or just for the sake of honor. Bluffing, gambling and hoping that luck is on your side… just prove that you are the king of beer poker!

An endless social world waiting for you. One where you can be anything and anyone – no judgements, no barriers, no limits.

boardgame.name: Wie is Wie
boardgame.description:
Are you good at guessing famous people? Then this game is for you. Here it's all about the question: Which famous person is on the map

Play the game in teams and try to guess which celebrity is involved in three different rounds, always using the same cards.

In round 1 you do this by explaining the celebrity in words, in round 2 you have to find out from a word and in round 3 the same people are portrayed. Whoever guesses the most celebrities in three rounds wins the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Het beste brein
boardgame.description:
Do you have the best brain in the Netherlands?

Congratulations… you are on your way to becoming "The Best Brain"! You grab that title in an exciting battle full of visual games and assignments based on the immensely popular TV quiz. And all this without even one knowledge question, because this fun board game is all about farmer smartness: a combination of common sense and good intuition. You absolutely do not need to have studied or to have a lot of knowledge ...


Everyone can participate and win!
With 8 rounds full of visual games and assignments like on TV now at home!


—description of the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Buff Knight Advanced
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Retro pixel RPG runner where you have to smash the enemies coming in with your sword to become the most powerful knight ever!

12 stages with each own boss as well as two playable heroes: Buff Knight or Buffy the Sorceress.

boardgame.name: iKNOW: All in
boardgame.description:
Are you a real quiz champion? Everyone plays at the same time, everyone bets on each other, but ... there is only one winner! Compared to other quiz games, iKNOW offers that little bit extra. You score points by answering questions correctly, but also by predicting the success of other players! How well do you know your opponents? Bet on the right player and score even if that player gives a wrong answer! This interactive trivia will get all players involved from start to finish!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Memories
boardgame.description:
Are you ready for a nostalgic evening of reminiscing? Travel through time with your fellow players and discover how much you still know about the decade in which you grew up.

What events are in
your memory and what do you have to dig deep for? Maybe you know more than your parents, your grandfather, your neighbor or your best friend.

Amaze yourself and everyone
by answering a variety of questions about the 80's, 90's, 00's and 10's in six categories: music, television, sports, world news, movies and miscellaneous.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cat Game
Cat Game - The Cats Collector!
boardgame.description:
Cat Game is a world where you can collect adorable cats, care for them, and build your dream cat house!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Party & Co Family
boardgame.description:
With Party & Co Family, you can imitate, draw, squirm, answer original questions and conquer the funniest challenges. Have fun with the new Party & Co Family: a party for the whole family!

The game can be played in teams (maximum 3 teams of 2 or more players) or with maximum 3 individuals. Divide the players into teams. Choose which side of the game board you want to play with: the normal course takes about 50 minutes. The short trail is about 25 minutes.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: British vs Pirates: Royal Guard Limited Mini Faction
boardgame.description:
The Royal Guard is a limited mini faction packed with 2 ship miniatures, 27 Skill Cards, 2 Ship Cards and 2 Captain Cards. This faction adds more variety in the world and gives players the ability to fight with new strategies using their unique skill cards. Welcome aboard, Captain!

"The noble Captains of the Royal Guard were once English aristocrats. They grew tired of the Crown's greedy taxation and began funding their own ventures. The wealth of the Royal Guard attracted many skilled Captains and even better ship builders. All formal factions despise their existence and call them no more than well dressed pirates. They return the hostility in the form of well aimed cannon shots."

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Party & Texaco
boardgame.description: The players are divided into teams. Party & Taxaco has assignments in the following categories: 1 lip reading, 2 facial expressions, gestures and sounds, 3 answer a question correctly, 4 sketches and drawings, 5 forbidden words. Try to complete all mission hats and you are the winner. Complete with manual. Suitable for 3-20 players, ages 8 and up

boardgame.name: Cats King
CATS KING - Battle Dog Wars: RPG Summoner
Cats King Premium - Battle Dog Wars: RPG Summoner

boardgame.name: Marãná
boardgame.description:
Marãná is a simple and strategic card game for 2 to 3 people with a focus on battle and inspired by brazilian native american culture. It uses unique positioning mechanics in three rows and four columns for each player. The position of each warrior card is crucial in determining who he can attack. The base game comes with 3 decks of 30 cards each and all cards are unique. In the match setup, you choose 20 of the 30 cards for that match. Each warrior is unique and has Strength and Dodge values that allow these characters to attack, counterattack or dodge in combat, creating an immersive and intense game. Strength or Dodge points earn a bonus from a D4 to increase the variability of combats and make them more real. No warrior is able to return once they have been defeated and the objective of the game is to leave the opponent's field without any card on it, which means instant victory.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Napoleon's Eagles 2: The Hundred Days – The Waterloo Campaign
Napoleon's Eagles 2: The Hundred Days – The Waterloo Campaign, June 1815
boardgame.description:
Napoleon’s Eagles 2: The Hundred Days, is the second game by designer Christopher Moeller in a series aiming to cover all of the great battles of the Napoleonic era. Following Napoleon’s Eagles: Storm in the East, The Hundred Days covers the Emperor Napoleon’s Belgian campaign in 1815: four battles that culminated in one of the most famous conflicts in history: Waterloo.

Featured are the final four battles of the Napoleonic age: Quatre Bras and Ligny (June 16, 1815), and Waterloo and Wavre (June 18, 1815). Two campaign games allow the battles of the 16th and 18th to be played together, as well as a grand campaign that combines all four battles.

While there are multiple scenarios presented in the game, each with its own special rules and conditions for victory, most battles are won by inflicting nine demoralizations on an opponent’s army, before they do the same to you. Combat is a back and forth affair, using specially designed decks of playing cards. Combat is simple, fast and straightforward, but has a number of subtle wrinkles that you’ll discover during play. Combat units, featuring glorious period artwork, represent infantry and cavalry formations, massed artillery formations, and those leaders operating at the highest levels (Wing and Army command).

Product information
Complexity: 5 out of 10
Solitaire Suitability: High
Time Scale: abstract (one full day of battle is 6 turns)
Unit Scale: Infantry and Cavalry Corps
Players: Two
Playing Time: 30 to 90 minutes; 4 hours for large campaign

Components
225 Poker-sized cards which include 89 Unit Cards, 32 Terrain and Info Cards, and 104 Playing Cards
Two Player Aid Cards
Three Scenario Set-up Cards
One Rules and Scenario Book
1 Box and Lid set

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: 100 Things to Find in a Place of Worship
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Characters may end up in a place of worship in many different settings, from fantasy to futuristic, and this supplement has 100 different items that can be used to decorate such a location. Some of the items may be valuable in nature but almost any religion will not appreciate items in its holy places being stolen, damaged or desecrated.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

Elephant Goad (Hook attached to a handle that is used to train elephants but is also a ritual tool)

Fans (Fans made of such as metal, leather, parchment, feathers or silk, possibly decorated if the material is suitable, used to keep insects away)

Fetishes (Objects considered to have supernatural powers or manmade objects believed to have power over others, sculptures being common but almost anything could be a fetish)

Fire Pot (A container for carrying fire, at the most basic earthenware tabletop bowls ranging up to large vessels several metres tall, may be made of such as carved gold or silver)

Flagon (Or similar container for serving consecrated liquids, often made of valuable materials)

One page is the front cover and one page is the front matter.

boardgame.name: A Baker's Dozen of Fantasy Vigilantes
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Power corrupts, and when justice is bound in such a way that it cannot threaten the cruel, the greedy and the despotic, it is only a matter of time before champions arise to say, "No more." While the annals of history are filled with the names of those who rose up against oppressors and tyrants, there are others who have fought this battle from behind the sheltering anonymity of a mask. These vigilantes stand alone against a dark sea of corruption, and it is only by denying their foes the ability to strike at them and their loved ones that they can carry on the fight so fearlessly. Many times, it is even the mask, rather than the face beneath it, that becomes the symbol of hope and courage for those who need something to believe in.

This supplement covers 13 vigilantes, each with their own unique persona, costume, rumors and origin story. Whether your game takes place in a major city with its own costumed protector, or across a region where a vigilante has become something of a campfire legend, there's bound to be something to suit your setting between these pages!

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

The vigilantes are as follows:

The Knight of the Steel Rose
The Crimson Mantis
Leatherback
Lorantha the Undying
The Harvestman
The Demon
The Queen of Thorns
The Whisper
The Harlequin
The Bloody Hand
The Black Storm
Mirror Masque
Smoke

One page is the front cover, one page the front matter and one page is ads.

boardgame.name: たぎる交差 (Tagiru Kōsa)
boardgame.description:
In たぎる交差 (Tagiru Kōsa), two players compete to deduce each other's scoring criteria, and the one who is able to do so first, wins.

More specifically, each player has a set of nine strips of paper; three each in three colors, with each color having one strip of A's, B's, and C's. Each player takes three scoring chips at random from a selection of twelve and assigns them point values of +2, +1, or -1. These criteria will look at the number of intersections of certain combinations, such as A strips crossing B strips, or red strips crossing other red strips.

The first player begins by playing one of their strips. The second player continues, placing a strip such that it intersects the first strip. Each player will then place one additional strip in turn, which must cross at least one strip, and may not make an intersection of more than 2 strips.

Once this is complete, each player calculates their sore. They then communicate to their opponent how many times in total their three criteria were triggered, and how many total points were earned. They only report these 2 numbers in total, and not broken down by each of the three criteria.

A three-minute deduction phase of the game then begins, as the players try to deduce which three scoring criteria the other player has in which slot. If a player attempts a guess and is wrong, their opponent secretly looks at one of the unused criteria.

If neither player guesses correctly, the crossing pattern and scoring results remain, and the players play additional rounds as necessary (up to 4 total rounds) with the same scoring criteria and their remaining strips, until one player wins or the game ends in a draw.

boardgame.name: Living Planet: Deluxe Edition
boardgame.description:
The Deluxe edition is a large black box that has slots for the base game and all expansions.

It contains the core set which also came with content not found in the retail edition: the campaign book with 5 scenarios, 4 map tiles, 4 technical units, 5 spatioports, 3 recycling factory, plus component upgrades.

In addition, the deluxe edition came with Living Planet: Industria.


About the game:In Living Planet, each player represents one major Galactic Corporation exploiting the distant planet MYC.14.250. Each one of them is eager to industrialize the planet and generate as much profit as possible before the planet self-destructs.

To do so, you'll have to explore the planet to grow the map. You'll manage your team to extract resources with factory buildings you've built, and trade resources at the stock market to make money. And above anything else, you'll have to handle cataclysms generated by the planet. But cataclysms don't happen randomly, players trigger them through their actions, using their card set. Confrontation between players will take place through the planet.

Players will alternately take the leader role for each turn. Each turn follows a specific game turn sequence. Every player will have some actions to accomplish at a turn, in the order the Leader chooses, resolving the sequence : Resources production - Action (Explore, Move, Construct, Trade…) - Cataclysms.

At the end of the game each player will earn victory points based on how much money they have and how many buildings and vehicles they control.

-description from the publisher

boardgame.name: たぎる表裏 (Tagiru Hyōri)
boardgame.description:
In たぎる表裏 (Tagiru Hyōri), three players each have 1 two-sided card and compete to deduce which card each player holds. Each player is able to see the front of their own card, and the back of the other two player's cards.

The game includes 10 two-sided number cards, and a several of question cards. On a player's turn, they choose one of the question cards and ask it; some will be answered by each player, and some are directed to a specific player.

The first player to deduce the numbers on each side of the three cards wins.

boardgame.name: Hue-nicorns
boardgame.description:
Up in the clouds, hue-nicorns are looking for some fun. Invite different hue-nicorns to join your camp and start the party!

During the game, players will move a sun token around 7 cloud cards. Players draft one hue-nicorn color tokens where the sun lands, then place that color token on their 3x3 player boards.

Which ever space they cover on their board determines the number of moves the sun token will advance for the next player. Line up three tokens of different colors on your player board to score 2 points or the same color for 4 points. Once scored, tokens are flipped revealing different number of moves.

The game ends when all tokens have been used. Player with the highest score wins!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Burgeon
boardgame.description:
Definition: "Burgeon - Begin to grow or increase rapidly"

Burgeon is a solo territory control game where you plant flowers and kill weeds.

The game starts on a 10x10 grid with three weeds randomly planted on the board and a weather token revealed above the board. Then the player draws three cards and uses two of them to plant flowers on the board that can kill the weeds. Careful where you plant the flowers however, some will kill your plants!

Each round the planted flowers and weeds grow, flourishing and spreading across the board depending on the weather. After 10 rounds, the game ends and points are scored to see if you win! The more flowers you have, the better your garden is and you gain more points. But if you have too many weeds, you'll get minus points and your garden will die.

—description from the designer
